perturbation.original_text: 1.2	"Affiliate" means in relation to any Person, any Subsidiary or Holding Company, and any company in which such Person or any such Holding Company holds or Controls directly or indirectly not less than 30% of the issued share capital.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2	"Affiliate" means in relation to any Person, any Subsidiary or Holding Company, and any company in which such Person or any such Holding Company holds or Controls directly or indirectly not less than 5% of the issued share capital.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of "Affiliate" is changed from 30% to 5%. This creates a legal contradiction because in other parts of the contract, "Control" is defined as 30% or more of the issued share capital. This contradiction could lead to uncertainty in determining which entities are considered affiliates.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Corporate Law - Definition of Affiliate and Control

perturbation.original_text: 1.11 "Consumer" means, in relation to a product or service or market for a product or service, an individual who takes the product or service for primarily non-business and non-work purposes (even if, for the avoidance of doubt, that individual sometimes, as a secondary purpose, uses the product or service for their work or business).
perturbation.changed_text: 1.11 "Consumer" means, in relation to a product or service or market for a product or service, an individual who uses the product or service for any purpose including business purposes.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of "Consumer" is altered to include individuals using the product/service for any purpose, including business. This contradicts the original definition, which specifically excludes primarily business purposes. This will impact the interpretation of other clauses that refer to "Consumer," creating ambiguity, especially given the "Enterprise Non-Competition Period" in section 8.1.2
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Interpretation of Consumer Agreements

perturbation.original_text: 1.16 "Gross Revenue" means any and all revenue actually received and collected by a Party, or any Subsidiary or other Affiliate, licensee, distributor or reseller thereof, from (i) any SkypeOut, SkypeIn or Skype Plus services (or other products or services similar to Skype Plus developed under this Agreement by the Parties) provided through or in connection with the Company-Skype Branded Application, Company-Skype Branded Content or Company-Skype Branded Web Site, and (ii) any advertising, licensing, distribution or other exploitation of the Company-Skype Branded Application, Company-Skype Branded Content or Company-Skype Branded Web Site.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.16 "Gross Revenue" means any and all revenue recognized by a Party, or any Subsidiary or other Affiliate, licensee, distributor or reseller thereof, from (i) any SkypeOut, SkypeIn or Skype Plus services (or other products or services similar to Skype Plus developed under this Agreement by the Parties) provided through or in connection with the Company-Skype Branded Application, Company-Skype Branded Content or Company-Skype Branded Web Site, and (ii) any advertising, licensing, distribution or other exploitation of the Company-Skype Branded Application, Company-Skype Branded Content or Company-Skype Branded Web Site.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of "Gross Revenue" is changed from "actually received and collected" to "recognized". This alters the timing of revenue recognition, conflicting with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) if 'recognized' does not align with actual receipt. This will affect revenue sharing calculations and create disputes.
